column1: Eséka is a small town in central Cameroon.
The city of Eséka lies on the main Camrail railway
column2: where the line enters more rugged terrain from the coastal plains.
a passenger train derailed close to the town.  The train
column3: traveling from the capital Yaoundé to the economic hub Douala was crammed with people due to road traffic disruption between the two cities and came off the tracks just before reaching Eséka. At least 60 people were killed with many hundreds injured.

column1: Site de la primature – Élections municipales 2002 (in French)

column2: La réforme de l’administration territoriale au Cameroun à la lumière de la loi constitutionnelle n° 96/06 du 18 janvier 1996
